1.verse: Chapter 1 -Salutation -To the Faithful in the Dispersion. -Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to all the exiles of the Dispersion who are now living in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

2.verse: chosen in the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification by the Spirit, to be obedient to Jesus Christ and to be sprinkled with his blood: may grace and peace be yours in abundance.

3.verse: The Privileges and Responsibilities of Salvation -The Song of the New Life. -Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. In his great mercy he has given us a new birth to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead

4.verse: and to an inheritance that is imperishable, undefiled, and unfading. It is reserved in heaven for you

5.verse: who because of your faith are being protected by God’s power until the salvation that is ready to be revealed at the end of time.

6.verse: This is a reason for you to rejoice, even if now for a little while you must suffer trials of many kinds.

7.verse: Thus, the genuine quality of your faith—which is more valuable than gold that is perishable even if it has been tested by fire—may be proved worthy of praise, glory, and honor when Jesus Christ is revealed.

8.verse: Although you have not seen him, you love him; and even though you do not see him now, you believe in him and are filled with a joy that is indescribable and glorious.

9.verse: For you are achieving the goal of your faith, that is, the salvation of your souls.

10.verse: This salvation was the subject of intense scrutiny and investigation by the Prophets who spoke about the grace that you were to receive.

11.verse: They were searching out the time and the circumstances to which the Spirit of Christ within them was pointing when it testified in advance to the sufferings that Christ would endure and the glories that would then follow.

12.verse: It was revealed to them that they were serving not themselves but you when they spoke of the things that have now been announced to you through those who proclaimed the good news to you by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven. Even the angels long to catch a glimpse of such things.

13.verse: Convictions for Living. -Therefore, prepare your minds for action. Be calm and fix your hopes completely on the grace that you will be granted at the revelation of Jesus Christ.

14.verse: Like obedient children, do not yield to the evil desires you had in your former ignorance.

15.verse: He who called you is holy. Therefore, be holy yourselves in all your conduct.

16.verse: For Scripture says, “Be holy, for I am holy.”

17.verse: If you address as Father the one who judges everyone impartially on the basis of each person’s deeds, live in reverent fear during the time of your exile here.

18.verse: For you are aware that you were ransomed from your futile way of life inherited from your ancestors not with perishable things like silver or gold,

19.verse: but with the precious blood of Christ, a lamb without blemish or defect.

20.verse: He was chosen before the foundation of the world, but in this final age he has been revealed for your sake.

21.verse: Through him you have come to believe in God, who raised him from the dead and gave him glory, so that your faith and your hope are fixed on God.

22.verse: Now that you have purified your souls by your obedience to truth so that you have genuine love for your brethren, love one another intensely with all your heart.

23.verse: You have been born anew, not of perishable but of imperishable seed, through the living and enduring word of God.

24.verse: For:All flesh is like grass,and all its glory like the flower of the field.The grass withers, and the flower fades,

25.verse: but the word of the Lord endures forever.It is this word that has been proclaimed to you.

1.verse: Chapter 2 -Rid yourselves, therefore, of all malice, and all deceit, hypocrisy, and envy, and all slander.

2.verse: Like newborn infants, long for pure spiritual milk, so that by it you may advance on the path to salvation,

3.verse: now that you have tasted that the Lord is good.

4.verse: The Mystery of the Church. -Come to him, a living stone, rejected by men but chosen by God and precious.

5.verse: You, too, are like living stones, being built up into a spiritual temple and a holy priesthood to offer spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

6.verse: For it states in Scripture,“See, I am laying a stone in Zion,a cornerstone chosen and precious.Whoever believes in itwill not be put to shame.”

7.verse: Therefore, it is precious to you who believe. However, for those who do not believe,“The stone that the builders rejectedhas become the cornerstone,”

8.verse: and“A stone that makes them stumble,and a rock that makes them fall.”They stumble because they disobey the word—for this they were born.

9.verse: But you are “a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people claimed by God as his own possession,” so that you may proclaim the praise of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light.

10.verse: Once you were not a people,but now you are God’s people.Once you had not received mercy,but now you have received mercy.

11.verse: God’s People in a Hostile World -Lead a Good Life amidst Pagans. -Beloved, I urge you as aliens and exiles not to succumb to the desires of the flesh that wage war against the soul.

12.verse: Conduct yourselves honorably among the Gentiles so that, although they now malign you as evildoers, they may observe your good works and glorify God on the day of visitation.

13.verse: Christianity Is Not a Subversive Group. -For the Lord’s sake, submit to every human institution, whether of the emperor as supreme

14.verse: or of governors as sent by him to punish those who do wrong and to commend those who do good works.

15.verse: For it is the will of God that by doing right you should silence the ignorant talk of fools.

16.verse: As servants of God, behave as free people, but do not use your freedom as a means to cover up wrongdoing.

17.verse: Give due honor to everyone. Love your fellow believers. Fear God. Honor the emperor.

18.verse: Recommendations for Slaves. -Slaves, submit to your masters with due respect, not only to those who are kind and forbearing but also to those who are harsh.

19.verse: It is a sign of grace if you endure the pain of unjust suffering because of your awareness of God.

20.verse: What credit do you deserve if you are patient when you are beaten for doing wrong? However, if you are patient when you do what is right and suffer for it, you have earned merit with God.

21.verse: This, in fact, is what you have been called to do, because Christ himself suffered for you and left an example for you to follow in his footsteps.

22.verse: He committed no sin,and no deceit was found on his lips.

23.verse: When he was abused, he did not retaliate. When he suffered, he made no threats, but he placed his trust in the one who judges justly.

24.verse: He himself bore our sins in his body on the cross, so that we might die to sin and live in righteousness.By his wounds you have been healed.

25.verse: For you were like sheep who had gone astray, but now you have returned to the shepherd and guardian of your souls.

1.verse: Chapter 3 -Recommendations for Spouses. -In the same way, you who are wives should accept the authority of your husbands. Then, even if they do not believe the word, they may be won over without words simply by the conduct of their wives

2.verse: as they observe your reverence and your chaste behavior.

3.verse: Do not seek to adorn yourself externally—by the braiding of your hair and the wearing of gold jewelry or fine clothing.

4.verse: Rather, let your adornment be of your inner self, the imperishable beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is precious in the sight of God.

5.verse: It was in this way that the holy women who placed their hope in God long ago used to adorn themselves and be submissive to their husbands.

6.verse: Thus, Sarah obeyed Abraham and called him her “lord.” You are now her daughters as long as you live good lives and never allow fears to alarm you.

7.verse: Likewise, you who are husbands must show consideration for your wives in your life together. Treat your wife with respect, for even though she is the weaker partner, she is also an equal heir of God’s gift of life. Thus, your prayers will not be hindered in any way.

8.verse: Mutual Love. -Finally, all of you should be united in spirit, sympathetic, filled with love for one another, compassionate, and humble.

9.verse: Do not repay evil with evil or abuse with abuse. On the contrary, repay with a blessing. This is what you were called to do, so that you might inherit a blessing.

10.verse: For:“If anyone wishes to love lifeand to experience good days,he must restrain his tongue from eviland his lips from deceitful speech.

11.verse: He must turn away from evil and do good,seek peace and pursue it.

12.verse: For the eyes of the Lord are on the righteousand his ears are attentive to their prayer.However, the face of the Lordis set against those who do evil.”

13.verse: Christian Conduct in Suffering and Persecution -The Blessings of Suffering for Righteousness. -Now who is going to harm you if you are eager to do what is right?

14.verse: Yet even if you should suffer for doing what is right, you are thereby blessed. Have no fear of others, and refuse to be intimidated by them.

15.verse: Rather, revere Christ as Lord in your hearts.Always be prepared to offer an explanation to anyone who asks you to justify the hope that is in you. However, do so with gentleness and respect

16.verse: and with a clean conscience so that those who slander you for your good behavior in Christ may be put to shame.

17.verse: For it is better to suffer for doing what is right, if such is the will of God, than for doing what is wrong.

18.verse: Christ’s Victory and Descent to the Netherworld, and Christian Baptism. -For Christ also suffered for our sins once for all, the righteous for the unrighteous, in order to bring you to God. He was put to death in the flesh but raised to life in the spirit.

19.verse: In the spirit also he went to preach to the spirits in prison,

20.verse: those who had refused to obey long ago while God waited patiently in the days of Noah during the building of the ark. In it only a few persons, eight in all, were saved through water.

21.verse: This water prefigured Baptism, which now saves you. It does so not by the washing away of dirt from the body but by the pledge of a good conscience given to God through the resurrection of Jesus Christ.

22.verse: He has entered heaven and is at the right hand of God, with angels, authorities, and powers made subject to him.

1.verse: Chapter 4 -Therefore, since Christ suffered in the flesh, you should arm yourselves also with the same intention. For anyone who has suffered in the flesh has finished with sin

2.verse: and for the remainder of life on earth must be ruled not by human passions but by the will of God.

3.verse: You have already spent enough time in doing what the Gentiles like to do, pursuing a life of debauchery, licentiousness, drunkenness, orgies, carousing, and sacrilegious idolatry.

4.verse: They are surprised that you no longer join them in a life of dissipation, and they revile you as a result.

5.verse: However, they will have to render an account to him who stands ready to judge the living and the dead.

6.verse: And this is the reason why the gospel was preached even to the dead, so that, although they might be judged in the flesh like men, they might enjoy the life of God in the spirit.

7.verse: Qualities of a Christian Community Waiting for Christ. -The end of all things is near. Therefore, lead disciplined lives and be watchful in prayer.

8.verse: Above all, maintain the fervor of your love for one another, because love covers a multitude of sins.

9.verse: Be hospitable to one another without complaining.

10.verse: Like good stewards of the varied graces of God, use whatever gift each one of you has received to serve one another.

11.verse: Whoever speaks should do so as one who is speaking the very words of God. Whoever serves should do so with the strength that God provides. In all things, let God be glorified through Jesus Christ, for to him belong all glory and power forever and ever. Amen.

12.verse: Courage and Joy in Suffering. -Beloved, do not be surprised that you are being tested by a fiery ordeal, as though it were something extraordinary.

13.verse: But rejoice insofar as you are sharing in the sufferings of Christ, so that your joy will be without limit when his glory is revealed.

14.verse: If you are reviled for the name of Christ, consider yourself blessed, for upon you rests the Spirit of glory and of God.

15.verse: However, let none of you suffer as a murderer, a thief, or any other kind of criminal, or as one who meddles in another person’s business.

16.verse: Let it be because you are a Christian, not considering it a disgrace, but glorifying God because you bear this name.

17.verse: The time has come for the judgment of the household of God to begin. If it begins with us, how will it end for those who refuse to obey the gospel of God?

18.verse: And:“If it is hard for the righteous to be saved,what will become of the godless and those who are sinners?”

19.verse: And so, those who suffer in accordance with God’s will entrust their souls to a faithful Creator, while continuing to do good.

1.verse: Chapter 5 -Faithful and Humble Leadership. -I now exhort the presbyters among you, as a fellow presbyter myself and a witness to the sufferings of Christ, and as one who has shared in the glory that is to be revealed.

2.verse: Be shepherds of the flock of God that has been entrusted to your care. Watch over it, not as a duty, but willingly in accord with the will of God, not for sordid gain, but because you are eager to do so.

3.verse: Do not lord it over those in your charge, but be examples to the flock.

4.verse: Then, when the chief Shepherd appears, you will receive the crown of glory that never fades away.

5.verse: Humility and Firm Faith. -In the same way, you who are younger must be submissive to those who are older. And all of you should clothe yourselves with humility in your relationships with one another, for“God opposes the proud,but he gives grace to the humble.”

6.verse: Therefore, humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God, so that at the proper time he may exalt you.

7.verse: Cast all your anxiety on him, because he cares about you.

8.verse: Remain sober and alert, for your enemy the devil is on the prowl like a roaring lion, looking for someone to devour.

9.verse: Resist him and be firm in your faith, for you are well aware that your brethren throughout the world are undergoing the same kinds of suffering.

10.verse: Promise of Strength and Vindication. -After you have suffered for a brief period, the God of all grace, who has called you to his eternal glory in Christ, will himself restore, confirm, strengthen, and support you.

11.verse: All power belongs to him forever and ever. Amen.

12.verse: Conclusion -Final Greetings. -I have written this brief letter to you through Silvanus, whom I regard as a faithful brother, in order to exhort you and to testify that this is the true grace of God. Stand firm in it.

13.verse: Your sister Church in Babylon sends you greetings, as does my son Mark.

14.verse: Greet one another with a loving kiss.Peace to all of you who are in Christ.
